``` python
enablers = load_enablers()
ccp = load_ccp()
srf_outs = load_srf_outs()
gcms = load_gcms()
lut = load_gcm_lut()

print(gcms[:200])
len(enablers), len(ccp), len(srf_outs), len(lut)
```

    # Objective 1
    ## Title: Collect and utilize accurate and disaggregated data as a basis for evidence-based policies
    ## Associated actions
    - a. Elaborate and implement a comprehensive strategy for impro

    (7, 4, 3, 23)

## SRF Formatting

Format SRF enablers, cross-cutting priorities, and outputs for LLM
consumption with full hierarchical context. These functions produce
markdown with headers and descriptions suitable for including in
prompts.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/themes.py#L62"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### fmt_enablers_ccp

>  fmt_enablers_ccp (items:list)

*Format enablers or cross-cutting priorities for LLM*

<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>items</td>
<td>list</td>
<td>List of enabler/CCP dicts with id, title, description</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Returns</strong></td>
<td><strong>str</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

``` python
enablers = load_enablers()
print(fmt_enablers_ccp(enablers[:2])[:400])
```

    ### Description
    IOMâ€™s diverse and capable people are our most valued asset. Through investing in better workforce planning and people management, we will facilitate their professional development and improve their daily workplace experience. ### get_srf_out

>  get_srf_out (objectives:list, output_id:str)

*Retrieve single SRF output with hierarchy*

<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>objectives</td>
<td>list</td>
<td>SRF objectives structure</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>output_id</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>Output ID to find</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Returns</strong></td>
<td><strong>dict | None</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

``` python
srf_outs = load_srf_outs()
out = get_srf_out(srf_outs, '1a11')
out['output']['title']
```

    'Crisis-affected populations in-need receive dignified shelter and settlement support.'

    ## SRF Output 1a11: Crisis-affected populations in-need receive dignified shelter and settlement support.
    ### Hierarchical Context
    **Objective 1**: Saving lives and protecting people on the move.
    **Long-term Outcome 1a:** Human suffering is alleviated while the dignity and rights of people affected by crises are upheld.
    **Short-term Outcome 1a1:** Crisis-affected populations have their basic needs met and have minimum living conditions with reduced barriers to access for marginalized and vulnerable individuals.

<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>

``` python
print(fmt_srf_outs(srf_outs, ['1a11', '1a31']))
```

    ## SRF Output 1a11: Crisis-affected populations in-need receive dignified shelter and settlement support.
    ### Hierarchical Context
    **Objective 1**: Saving lives and protecting people on the move.
    **Long-term Outcome 1a:** Human suffering is alleviated while the dignity and rights of people affected by crises are upheld.
    **Short-term Outcome 1a1:** Crisis-affected populations have their basic needs met and have minimum living conditions with reduced barriers to access for marginalized and vulnerable individuals.

    ## SRF Output 1a31: Guidelines on data and information collection, sharing and management are in place that adhere to data protection standards, principles of confidentiality and a defined purpose, to protect the individuals and groups providing information from harm.
    ### Hierarchical Context
    **Objective 1**: Saving lives and protecting people on the move.
    **Long-term Outcome 1a:** Human suffering is alleviated while the dignity and rights of people affected by crises are upheld.
    **Short-term Outcome 1a3:** Decision makers and responders responsibly use data and its analysis to inform the delivery of assistance to crisis-affected populations.

## GCM Functions

Link Global Compact for Migration (GCM) objectives to SRF outputs. The
lookup table maps GCM objective IDs to their corresponding SRF output
IDs.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/franckalbinet/iomeval/blob/main/iomeval/themes.py#L101"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### get_srf_outs

>  get_srf_outs (lut:dict, gcm_ids:list)

*Get SRF output IDs filtered by GCM IDs*

<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>lut</td>
<td>dict</td>
<td>GCM to SRF lookup dict</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>gcm_ids</td>
<td>list</td>
<td>List of GCM IDs to filter by</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Returns</strong></td>
<td><strong>L</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

``` python
gcm_lut = load_gcm_lut()
out_ids = get_srf_outs(gcm_lut, ['1', '4'])
out_ids[:5]
```

    (#5) ['1a31','1a32','1b11','3b31','3c13']

### load_all_themes

>  load_all_themes (path:str=None)

*Load all theme data from path*

<table>
<colgroup>
<col style="width: 6%" />
<col style="width: 25%" />
<col style="width: 34%" />
<col style="width: 34%" />
</colgroup>
<thead>
<tr>
<th></th>
<th><strong>Type</strong></th>
<th><strong>Default</strong></th>
<th><strong>Details</strong></th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>path</td>
<td>str</td>
<td>None</td>
<td>Directory containing theme JSON files</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong>Returns</strong></td>
<td><strong>AttrDict</strong></td>
<td></td>
<td><strong>Dict with enablers, ccp, gcms, srf_outs,
gcm_lut</strong></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

``` python
all_themes = load_all_themes()
all_themes.keys()
```

    dict_keys(['enablers', 'ccp', 'gcms', 'srf_outs', 'gcm_lut'])

``` python
ccp = load_ccp()
test_eq(len(enablers), 7)
test_eq(enablers[0]['title'], 'Workforce')
test_eq(len(ccp), 4)
test_eq(len(srf_outs), 3)
```
